Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Tests] Make network tests a bit more resilient" (#2279) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
We often see networ test "failures" caused by unreachability of one of the
servers those tests use. This creates false negatives since this is not really
the test failing but rather the environment not being correct and preventing the
test from performing its actual task.
This commit catches the `WebException` thrown in connection failed cases and
merely ignores the test instead of failing it. Full exception message and stack
trace is printed as part of the ignore message.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Bump to mono:2018-06" (#1836) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Closed issue "Problem with using updated FSharp.Core " (#2270) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open new F# Blank App (Android) project
2. Update FSharp.Core nuget to any version higher than 4.0.0.1

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior

Everything should work like at the beginning.

### Actual Behavior

The project cannot be built because of three errors: 

> Error	FS1108	The type 'BigInteger' is required here and is unavailable. You must add a reference to assembly 'System.Numerics, Version=2.0.5.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089'.

> Error	FS0039	The type 'int' is not defined. Maybe you want one of the following:
>    Int16
>    Int32
>    Int64
>    IntPtr
>    Intent	

and

> Error	FS0039	The field, constructor or member 'Add' is not defined.	

First one is connected with whole project and appears only after trying to build.
The second one appears with every `: int` like in `let mutable count:int = 1`. 
The third one is connected with lines:
```FSharp
        button.Click.Add (fun args -> 
            button.Text <- sprintf "%d clicks!" count
            count <- count + 1
        )
```

The second one appears also after defining other variables with aliases as types' names (e.g. float, string)
```FSharp
let test : float = 1.0
let test : string = "test"
```

All problems disappear after adding System.Numerics to project's dependencies.

### Version Information

> Visual Studio 15.8.6

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "SupportActionMode Menu not updated in Android when using DataTemplateSelector " (#4041) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
If a ListView uses DataTemplateSelector for it's ItemTemplate with different ContextActions the SupportActionMode Menu is not updated when the selection changes between different ItemTemplates changes.

How to reproduce:
1. Create ListView with DataTemplateSelector and different ContextActions for each template
2. Run app on Android
3. Long press on Item and watch SupportActionMode Menu appear
4. Select an other item with a different template
5. SupportActionMode Menu isn't updated

Possible solution:
Check if ContextActions collection has changed when ActionModeContext is set.
https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/blob/f79fc69b9e85ebd946bd7128c414735860bcc9f2/Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android/CellAdapter.cs#L47
